channel.title: Data Science Portfolio on Anjali Ramesh
channel.description: Recent content in Data Science Portfolio on Anjali Ramesh

item.title: Project 2: Exploratory Data Analysis of the Air Quality of India
item.description: Technical Stack: Pandas, NumPy, matplotlib, seaborn Analyzed air quality of India with data containing 6+ million records and 20+ air quality features. Utilized various types of data analysis techniques including outlier removal, univariate analysis, multivariate analysis, and time series analysis to gain insights into air pollution trends and patterns. Identified a correlation (63%) between population and Air Quality Index (AQI), highlighting the need for targeted pollution control measures in highly populated states to mitigate the adverse effects of air pollution.

item.title: Project 1: Sales Forecasting with Machine Learning
item.description: Technical Stack: Pandas, NumPy, EDA - matplotlib, seaborn Machine Learning - scikit-learn (Regression with Linear & Ensemble models), XGBoost Conducted thorough data cleaning and analysis on a substantial retail store dataset comprising over 420,000 rows and 16 columns, with the objective of predicting weekly sales Employed a variety of machine learning algorithms, including linear models, random forests, and gradient-boosted trees, utilizing libraries such as scikit-learn, XGBoost, and LightGBM Attained a weighted mean absolute error of $4000, positioning the project among the top 50% of submissions on the Kaggle platform.

item.title: About
item.description: Unleashing the Power of Data Across Disciplines: Join Me, a Versatile Data Scientist with Expertise in Mathematics, Physics, Education, and Art. Let’s Innovate, Discover, and Dance with Data! Anjali Ramesh is a highly skilled data scientist and mathematician with a passion for uncovering insights from complex datasets. With a strong educational background and extensive practical experience, Anjali has developed expertise in data analysis, machine learning, and Python programming. Anjali holds a Master of Natural Science degree in Earth & Space Exploration from Arizona State University, which she completed in 2023.

item.title: Experience
item.description: Work Experience Teaching Assistant | Aug 2022 - May 2023 Arizona State University, Tempe, AZ Instructed Introductory Astronomy Labs (AST 113) to 100+ students 500+ hours of grading and science communication Research Assistant | Aug 2020 - Jul 2022 Arizona State University, Tempe, AZ Processed 500+GB of raw interferometric data (ALMA) using Python scripts, resulting in the calibration and generation of clear images for 26 radio frequency objects, enabling further analysis and insights Employed advanced image statistical modeling techniques (surface brightness profile, spectral energy distribution) using Python to analyze vital physical characteristics (size, shape, magnitude) of radio frequency objects Made a significant discovery that distant massive galaxies demonstrate central star formation and harbor compact star-forming regions, contributing to the broader understanding of galactic evolution and astrophysical processes Collaborated with a multidisciplinary team of astronomers, astrophysicists, and statisticians to design and execute data-driven research projects Communicated complex technical concepts and findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders through poster presentations at 2 conferences Junior Data Scientist | May 2019-Jun 2020

item.title: Skills
item.description: Skill Stack Programming: Python, MATLAB, SQL, Cypher Libraries: Pandas, NumPy, SciPy, statsmodels, scikit-learn, XGBoost, LightGBM, OpenCV Frameworks: TensorFlow, Keras, Flask Visualization Software & Libraries: Tableau, matplotlib, seaborn, plotly, folium Databases: MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, neo4j, BigQuery Functional: Jira, Git, GitHub
